name: Charlotte
messages: Shit, I'm broke, so unfathomably broke.
So broke that if I kept using the word broke it'd lose all meaning.
Broke.

name: Charlotte
messages: Boak.
Seconds later

name: Charlotte
messages: Statistically speaking rich people tend to have a lot of money,
If only there was some way in which I could steal from or get rich people to fund me...

name: Charlotte
messages: Eureka!

name: Charlotte
messages: How do you do this though?
Alright okay, time to search this one up.
Aaaaand they cut off my Wi-Fi. God, damn it.
Right, Jim Norton's free Wi-Fi it is.
A twenty-minute walk later...

name: Charlotte
messages: Alright, so, the web's saying: Be secure in yourself, super confident, be hard to get, frequent rich people areas, always look good, and be honest.

name: Charlotte
messages: Wow, there's a lot more to this than I thought.
It's basically a full time job being a trophy wife, sounds brutal selling yourself out to a shitty guy actually,
at least the pay's good.

name: Charlotte
messages: I don't think I can hack it actually, I'm like the complete opposite of that.
Not to mention the safety aspect to it, geez.
*She looks down at her purse, opens it, and a fly flies out*

name: Charlotte
messages: Guess I have no choice then.
Some time later, late, in a rich-people-area bar...

name: Charlotte
messages: Oh god what am I doing I hate this I hate life. Haven't even paid for a drink yet I hope they don't throw me out.

I was able to snag a cocktail glass, ask for water, pour the water into the cocktail glass along with some food colouring to make it look like I'm drinking something fancy. I'm too sober for this shit.
The bar's quite busy, I can see a bunch of people in suits, business casual, some with their sweaters tied around their neck. The type of person that's definitly played polo earlier today.
Some time passes, nobody's approached me.

name: Charlotte
messages: I'm going to the smoking area, fuck this, fuck everything...
Smoking area...
I light up. Richmond's.

What even are the other options? Can't live with family since I was kicked out. Can't live off minimum wage with medical bills, prostitution isn't safe, and suicide doesn't sound particularly fun either.
Could maybe sell my spare organs...

name: Guy
messages: Heyyyyy what's good bbg xoxox
He was a young rich man who looked and acted like a Labrador. Slightly drunk, but low-key a bit of Himbo.

name: Charlotte
messages: Ew, kill yourself x.
(Am I doing this right?)
He just looked kind of upset.

name: Guy
messages: Umm, maybe, (he sniffed, trying to hold back a slow forming tear), I could buy you a drink?
Jackpot

name: Charlotte
messages: You're not even going to ask my name?

name: Guy
messages: My name's Quentin.

name: Charlotte
messages: Charlotte.
Fucking Quentin?!
We walk to the bar, he pays for my drink, a bramble, and we chat. He goes on something or other about this business his father gave him, I high-key wasn't listening to all that.
He mentioned something about fast cars and champagne, I complimented him on his watch, a Tag Heute.
I felt kind of bad manipulating this naive puppy of a man, although just enough of me despised his entitlement and was envious of his easy life that I didn't feel too bad.
Some weeks later...
Guess I'm pregnant now.
Just kidding, I can't do that.

Living at this guys house isn't too bad, it's quite spacious and there's always food. They even have a cleaner! He won't buy me much yet, even if I try to push it. I thought that was like a big part of all this but I guess not.
He's a bit pathetic sometimes, but harmless. Guess my judgement was right.
More time later...

After several years of this carry-on I'd gotten enough money to prop myself up again. I do feel for the guy, one of his parents passed away which is why he had gotten the company and money, but I do not want to be his stay at home wife.
I needed something to leave him over. So I start rummaging around his stuff while he was away one day.
Turns out it's all a front, his wealth and the business. He's in as much debt as I was, maybe even more.
... Do I leave this guy?
0: Bourgeois scum, leave him to his fate.
1: Nah, I know what its like.
I waited until he got home and held up the papers.

name: Charlotte
messages: What the eff is this meant to be?

name: Quentin
messages: What?
Ohh yeahhhhh, that.

name: Quentin
messages: Ehh, I can just sell it. Never really liked the company any ways.
Dad was always forcing me learn how to run it before he passed. Selling shoes just isn't my thing, but he wouldn't have it.
(Wait... it's a shoe company?)

name: Charlotte
messages: What about the workers?

name: Quentin
messages: Oh, yeah, those people.
Uhh, they can find somewhere else I guess. They should know by now this was inevitable.

name: Charlotte
messages: You haven't told them?

name: Quentin
messages: Umm..... No?

name: Quentin
messages: pleasedonthurtme.
I throw the papers at him, and start breaking the shit out of the house. I grab the nearest vase and smash it on the floor. He winces and folds into himself.
In the kitchen I grab the Special C (pretty expensive if I recall) and pour it all over the floor.
'Oops...'
I find a rolling pin, and throw it at the kitchen TV. It smashes to pieces. I grab several knives and forks from the cutlery drawer, stuff them in the microwave, and turn it on.
I grab the tablecloth and yank downwards. The table items remain untouched.
This vexes me...
I run up to him, stare at him for two seconds, he cries and pisses himself, the microwave bursts into flames, I realise what I've done, it's based. I defecate on the floor, then storm out the door.

name: Charlotte
messages: You'll see me no more, you bore!

name: Quentin
messages: You whore!
I run back into the smoking building, and drop-kick him in the gut before making my second exit.

name: Charlotte
messages: ...This is all a bit extreme.

name: Quentin
messages: (Stumbling out his fuming abode, wearily) Yeah, what gives?
I waited until he got home.

name: Charlotte
messages: Hey guy, I found this.
I show him the papers.

name: Quentin
messages: Yeah... It's not looking good.

name: Charlotte
messages: ...What're you gonna do?

name: Quentin
messages: I'm going to have to sell the company.

name: Charlotte
messages: Makes sense.

name: Quentin
messages: ...and the house.

name: Charlotte
messages: You're telling me you didn't see this coming?

name: Quentin
messages: Nope. Should've sold it when I got it but I'd never have heard the end of it since it was inherited from my fathers passing. Never was into shoes any ways, no matter how much he tried to make me.

name: Quentin
messages: Didn't I tell you all this before?

name: Charlotte
messages: No, wait, maybe, but umm, the bar was very loud :)
and I didn't hear that part :)

name: Quentin
messages: Oh ok.

name: Quentin
messages: It's actually been this way a while, that night I was actually looking for someone rich I could marry into and be sorted.

name: Charlotte
messages: You didn't do a very good job.

name: Quentin
messages: ...Evidently.

name: Charlotte
messages: As if you're any better.

name: Charlotte
messages: What about the employees?

name: Quentin
messages: Eeeee....

name: Quentin
messages: ...yikes.

name: Quentin
messages: Yeah.

name: Quentin
messages: Uhh.

name: Quentin
messages: I don't really know what to do.
If I'd married rich I could've probably turned things around, start winding things down, give them time to find new jobs and stuff, and reinvest.

name: Quentin
messages: I don't know if I can do that now.

name: Charlotte
messages: So when'd you realise I was broke?

name: Quentin
messages: Now.
THE END.
Thanks for playing!
0: Start over
1: Credits
2: Quit Game
Made by Hollie Greer
Special Thanks: Hideo Kojima
